Articles.Content:
[quote name='jrolson']I installed this mod on a clean install of KSP and it made the shuttle engines sound different. Then I deleted the mod and engine sounds were back to normal. So it's clearly this mod changing the engines sound somehow...

I think this problem only came from the recent update of chatterer as I don't remember the previous version having it...[/QUOTE]

Sorry, I can't reproduce this issue here :(
Also I have no clue about what could cause this.

[quote name='CorBlimey']would you consider a chatterer that keeps the chat in native tongue?

(love the unintelligble kerbal voice, but would also enjoy hearing the original voice for a change)[/QUOTE]

Once KSPv1.1 is out (and if 64bits support turn to work fine) you will be able to add any soundset you wish.
I will try to do this as simple as possible, like copy/pasta folders which will be autodetected by the mod and voilÃƒÂ  (with still a possibility to turn them on/off ingame)

Right now, you can already do this but it is kinda complex and you might reach the infamous 32bits memory limits quite fast.

;)

I dunno why i didnt get this mod earlier, i always had it in the back of my head... ah well better late than never right?

Huge thanks to the original author, and you for keeping this up, it makes big difference in gameplay.

I think Chatterer loses changes to its settings (at least volume levels) when you Revert a flight. To reproduce:

1) Put a ship on launchpad
2) Change Chatterer volumes
3) Launch
4) Revert flight to Launch Edited November 24, 2015 by Fwiffo

I totally love Chatterer, would find it hard to live without it, even..

Which is why it pains me to have to write this.

In Windows, Chatterer runs fine, even with 40-50 other mods installed.. but when I try to run KSP in Linux, the game freezes/crashes before loading is even partly complete.

My laptop specs: Asus F3Jr, Intel Core2 Duo - 1.73GHz, 4GB RAM (due to hardware limitations, system can only access 3GB), ATI Mobility Radeon X2300 - 128 MB. Linux Mint17.2. KSP 1.0.5. Chatterer 0.9.7


On a vanilla install of KSP Linux, the game when loaded takes up around 2.1 - 2.2 GB of RAM. If Chatterer is then installed (no other mods), memory usage keeps on rapidly climbing until around 3.5GB is in use, at which point enough of the game has been swapped out to hard disk that the game freezes. At this point the loading progress bar has only reached 5-10%. This happens with both the 32 and 64 bit versions of the game, and was also happening in KSP 1.0.4 with Chatterer 0.9.6, though at that time, I hadn't pinned the problem down to Chatterer. Memory usage has been confirmed with both the Linux system monitor and Sarbian's Graphic Memory Monitor mod.

 

It seems Chatterer just keeps allocating memory until none is left. So far, nothing appears in the logs, at all. In fact, the log file hasn't even recorded the last several attempts at running the game.


 

Edited December 4, 2015 by JAFO
Added more details

So, when ever i launch up my KSP and play, Chatterer doesn't seem to work (SSTV & Radio Chatterer doesn't work, but other stuff like the Airlock SFX and Ect. works) even though I installed it correctly. Any help?

Edit: Fixed it, I wasn't supposed to put the Plugins in the Plugins folder  silly me.

Edited December 28, 2015 by Kerbl101
No issues here with Chatterer on Ubuntu Gnome 64bit (32GB RAM, NVIDIA GTX 760, Intel i7).
Could you make Chatterer zip it while in re-entry? There is a sheath of plasma around my ship and there is no way in **** a signal is getting through.

5 minutes ago, Whovian41110 said:

Could you make Chatterer zip it while in re-entry? There is a sheath of plasma around my ship and there is no way in **** a signal is getting through.

I like this observation -- I'm sure (hope) there's an "in reentry" condition to check for -- or at the very least the set of conditions that produce the effects would also silence the radio communications. The rest of chatterer's effects should continue, though.

9 hours ago, Whovian41110 said:

Could you make Chatterer zip it while in re-entry? There is a sheath of plasma around my ship and there is no way in **** a signal is getting through.

Well, as it happens, about 6 months ago, Chinese researchers came up with a new antenna design concept that looks as if it will eliminate comms blackouts during re-entry.. I just pretend that Kerbal scientists have already figured this solution out..

Edited January 20, 2016 by JAFO

Could you make Chatterer zip it while in re-entry? There is a sheath of plasma around my ship and there is no way in **** a signal is getting through.

Well, as it happens, about 6 months ago, Chinese researchers came up with a new antenna design concept that looks as if it will eliminate comms blackouts during re-entry.. I just pretend that Kerbal scientists have already figured this solution out..

 

Ok this is it, Kerbal had this technology from the start !

Issue closed.

 

 

Nah just kidding ^^ I like realism and definitely put this re-entry "shut up!" on my to do list.

Thanks Whovian for the head up

You're welcome.  I noticed when returning from the Mun.

It's just capsule chatter and mission control checking to see if the ship can be contacted yet.  Sheesh, Can't you people translate Kerbal yet?

 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9fMhzvfwfBU

I don't see any instructions to how to add custom chat sets. :-/

26 minutes ago, theonegalen said:

I don't see any instructions to how to add custom chat sets. :-/

Check your "Chatterer\Sounds\chatter" folder and its content. And than add new sets the same way.
By the way, you may want to move your kerbalstuff download to spacedock, as kerbalstuff no longer exists.

Done

RIP Kerbalstuff

Chatterer is definitely a must-have mod. However, as a radio enthusiast (amateur radio op here, KI6UAP), I wonder if we could have a more modern digital mode sound for the science transmission, instead of SSTV? Something like PSK, or even regular telephone modem sounds would be much more "technically accurate".

2 hours ago, websterhamster said:

Chatterer is definitely a must-have mod. However, as a radio enthusiast (amateur radio op here, KI6UAP), I wonder if we could have a more modern digital mode sound for the science transmission, instead of SSTV? Something like PSK, or even regular telephone modem sounds would be much more "technically accurate".

Hi,

Loving the idea, what about bounding this to KSC Tracking station level :

  • Level 1 : SSTV
  • Level 2 : PSK
  • Level 3 : Modem

Put this on my to do list, thanks for the idea

For generating the different digital mode sounds, here's a great piece of software. It's very complex, but encompasses just about every conceivable digital mode used by amateur radio operators, from CW (Morse code) to Hellschreiber to Radio Teletype to packet modem noises.

http://multipsk.eqth.info/
Val said EVA when I had the mouse on EVA. O-o

I don't know if I'm bad at designing Rovers, but mine is making chatter go nuts.

 

As the rover drive it will switch from landed to flying low condition and this seems to be a chatter condition for creating noise and it becomes a bit too extreme if your driving for any length of time..
